definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: They proclaimed him a model worker…
sentences.chinese: 它們宣佈他爲勞動模範。

sentences.english: The concept of the user model is similar to working model or a model in real life.
sentences.chinese: 模範用戶的概念類似於現實生活中的勞動模範或標兵。

sentences.english: The Paper studies the self –identity of the model workers in contemporary state-owned enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 文章研究當代國有企業工人勞動模範的自我認同狀況。

sentences.english: Model workers were chosen by a show of hands.
sentences.chinese: 舉手表決選出勞動模範。

sentences.english: The veteran workers and model workers are held in great esteem.
sentences.chinese: 老工人和勞動模範深受尊敬。

sentences.english: Standing by him was a model worker.
sentences.chinese: 站在他旁的是一位勞動模範。

sentences.english: She is honored as a model worker.
Her uncle is a labor paragon.
sentences.chinese: 她的叔叔是一名勞動模範。

sentences.english: I won the title of" Model Worker" two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 兩年前我榮獲“勞動模範”的光榮稱號。

sentences.english: The East Beach is reserved for "model workers" and the army.
sentences.chinese: 東灘是給勞動模範和解放軍戰士修養。

sentences.english: They were honoured with the title of model workers.
sentences.chinese: 他們被授予勞動模範的光榮稱號。
